Actions.Text: REFERRED TO CRIME VICTIMS, CRIME AND CORRECTION
DEFEATED IN CRIME VICTIMS, CRIME AND CORRECTION
REFERRED TO CRIME VICTIMS, CRIME AND CORRECTION

Title: Increases from twenty-four to sixty months, the time for which reconsideration for parole for a violent felony offense shall be determined
Summary: Enacts "Lorraine's Law"; increases from twenty-four to sixty months, the time for which reconsideration for parole for a violent felony offense shall be determined.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to the time in which reconsideration for parole shall be determined in the case of convictions for murder in the first degree, aggravated murder, and murder in the second degree, where a sentence other than death or life imprisonment without parole is imposed
